intro: Anneslia humilis, commonly known as the dwarf anneslia, is a small, herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pale pink, bloom in spring and attract various pollinators. Anneslia humilis is often cultivated in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and low maintenance requirements.
